segment.source: When you add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list entries, they’re validated by the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager before they’re entered into your global list.
segment.target: When you add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list entries, they’re validated by the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager before they’re entered into your global list.

segment.source: Fix validation problems using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Fix validation problems using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Fix validation problems using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager
segment.target: Fix validation problems using the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager

segment.source: Applies to:
segment.target: Applies to:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1)

segment.source: When you add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list entries, they’re validated by the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager before they’re entered into your global list.
segment.target: When you add multiple sites to your Enterprise Mode site list entries, they’re validated by the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager before they’re entered into your global list.

segment.source: If a site doesn’t pass validation, you’ll have a couple of options to address it.
segment.target: If a site doesn’t pass validation, you’ll have a couple of options to address it.

segment.source: There are typically 3 types of errors you’ll see:
segment.target: There are typically 3 types of errors you’ll see:

segment.source: Validation.
segment.target: Validation.

segment.source: The site caused a validation error.
segment.target: The site caused a validation error.

segment.source: Typically these occur because of typos, malformed URLs, or access-related issues.
segment.target: Typically these occur because of typos, malformed URLs, or access-related issues.

segment.source: You can pick the site, click Add to list to ignore the problem and accept the site to your site list, or you can click OK to keep the site off of your site list.
segment.target: You can pick the site, click Add to list to ignore the problem and accept the site to your site list, or you can click OK to keep the site off of your site list.

segment.source: Duplicate.
segment.target: Duplicate.

segment.source: The site already exists in the global compatibility list with a different compatibility mode.
segment.target: The site already exists in the global compatibility list with a different compatibility mode.

segment.source: For example, the site was originally rendered in Enterprise Mode, but this update is for Default IE.
segment.target: For example, the site was originally rendered in Enterprise Mode, but this update is for Default IE.

segment.source: You can pick the site, click Add to list to ignore the problem and accept the change to your site list, or you can click OK to keep your original compatibility mode.
segment.target: You can pick the site, click Add to list to ignore the problem and accept the change to your site list, or you can click OK to keep your original compatibility mode.

segment.source: Redirection.
segment.target: Redirection.

segment.source: This is the least common type of validation error.
segment.target: This is the least common type of validation error.

segment.source: Typically in this situation, a site redirects from an easy-to-remember URL to a longer URL.
segment.target: Typically in this situation, a site redirects from an easy-to-remember URL to a longer URL.

segment.source: Like redirects to .
segment.target: Like redirects to .

segment.source: You can add the short URL or you can add both the short and long versions to your list.
segment.target: You can add the short URL or you can add both the short and long versions to your list.

segment.source: Another possibility is that redirection happens multiple times, with an intermediary site experiencing compatibility issues.
segment.target: Another possibility is that redirection happens multiple times, with an intermediary site experiencing compatibility issues.

segment.source: For example, an employee types a short URL that then redirects multiple times, finally ending up on a non-intranet site.
segment.target: For example, an employee types a short URL that then redirects multiple times, finally ending up on a non-intranet site.

segment.source: In this situation, you might want to add the intermediary URLs to your Enterprise Mode site list, in case there’s logic in one of them that has compatibility issues.
segment.target: In this situation, you might want to add the intermediary URLs to your Enterprise Mode site list, in case there’s logic in one of them that has compatibility issues.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Download the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.2)

segment.source: Download the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1)
segment.target: Download the Enterprise Mode Site List Manager (schema v.1)
